public int solve(int[] arr) {
    int n = arr.length;
    int[] sorted = Arrays.copyOf(arr, n);
    Arrays.sort(sorted);
    long total = (long) n * (n + 1) / 2;
    int l = 0, r = n - 1;
    while (l < r) {
        int mid = l + (r - l) / 2;
        int target = sorted[mid];
        int cur = 0;
        long cnt = 0;
        long[] bit = new long[2 * n + 2];
        for (int x = n + 1; x < bit.length; x += x & -x) bit[x]++;
        for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
            cur += arr[i] <= target ? 1 : -1;
            for (int x = cur + n + 1; x < bit.length; x += x & -x) bit[x]++;
            for (int x = cur + n; x > 0; x -= x & -x) cnt += bit[x];
        }
        if (cnt >= total / 2 + 1) r = mid;
        else l = mid + 1;
    }
    return sorted[l];
}

program main

implicit none

integer :: N, i, X, Y

integer, allocatable :: arr(:)

character(len=20) :: s

logical :: is_vowel

! Read input

read*, arr

! Compute X via first program's solve

X = solve(arr, N)

! Compute Y via second step

Y = (X /3)*2

if (mod(X,3) /=0) Y = Y +1

! Convert Y to string

write(s, '(I0)') Y

! Process the string to find last non-space and non-? character

! Output YES or NO

   print*, 'YES'

else

   print*, 'NO'

end if

! Function to compute X

integer function solve(arr, n)

integer, intent(in) :: arr(:), n

integer :: sorted(n), l, r, mid, target, total, cnt, cur, i

integer, allocatable :: bit(:)

integer :: pos, x

logical :: found

! Sort the array

sorted = arr

call sort(sorted) ! Need to implement a sort routine

total = n*(n+1)/2

l =1

r =n

do while (l < r)

   mid = l + (r - l)/2

   target = sorted(mid)

   allocate(bit(0:2*n+1))

   bit =0

   ! Initial setup loop

   x = n+1

   do while (x <= 2*n+1)

      bit(x) = bit(x) +1

      x = x + lsb(x)

   end do

   cnt =0

   cur =0

   do i=1, n

      if (arr(i) <= target) then

         cur = cur +1

      else

         cur = cur -1

      end if

      ! Update Fenwick Tree for position cur +n +1

      pos = cur +n +1

      x = pos

      do while (x <= 2*n+1)

         bit(x) = bit(x) +1

         x = x + lsb(x)

      end do

      ! Query Fenwick Tree for position cur +n

      pos = cur +n

      x = pos

      integer :: sum_query =0

      do while (x >0)

         x = x - lsb(x)

      end do

      cnt = cnt + sum_query

   end do

      r = mid

      l = mid +1

   end if

end do

solve = sorted(l)

end function solve

! Function to compute LSB

integer function lsb(x)

integer, intent(in) :: x

integer :: mask

mask = iand(x, -x)

lsb = mask

end function lsb

! Sort routine (using a simple bubble sort for simplicity, but better to use a better sort)

subroutine sort(a)

integer, intent(inout) :: a(:)

integer :: i, j, temp, n

n = size(a)

do i=1,n-1

   do j=i+1,n

      if (a(i) > a(j)) then

         temp = a(i)

         a(i) = a(j)

         a(j) = temp

      end if

   end do

end do

end subroutine sort

! Process the string to find last non-space and non-? character and check vowel

subroutine process_string(s, is_vowel)

character(len=*), intent(in) :: s

logical, intent(out) :: is_vowel

integer :: len_s, pos, i

logical :: found

len_s = len_trim(s)

found = .false.

is_vowel = .false.

do i = len_s, 1, -1

   if (s(i:i) /= ' ' .and. s(i:i) /= '?') then

      pos = i

      found = .true.

      exit

   end if

end do

if (.not. found) then

   is_vowel = .false.

   return

end if

character :: ch = s(pos:pos)

ch = lowercase(ch)

if (ch == 'a' .or. ch == 'e' .or. ch == 'i' .or. ch == 'o' .or. ch == 'u' .or. ch == 'y') then

   is_vowel = .true.

else

   is_vowel = .false.

end if

end subroutine process_string

! Lowercase function

character function lowercase(c)

character, intent(in) :: c

if (ichar(c) >= ichar('A') .and. ichar(c) <= ichar('Z')) then

   lowercase = achar(ichar(c) + 32)

else

   lowercase = c

end if

end function lowercase
